PopupEvent

enspire.interactivity.events.InteractivityEvent
enspire.interactivity.events.PopupEvent

Event dispatched from the interactivity API.  It sends all the appropriate text to the surrounding application to display a popup with a close/continue button.

Summary
PopupEventEvent dispatched from the interactivity API.
Variables
text
buttonText
Functions
PopupEventCreates a new PopupEvent.

Variables

Functions

PopupEvent

public function PopupEvent(type: Number,
data: Object)

Creates a new PopupEvent.

Example

var pe = new PopupEvent(InteractivityEvent.POPUP,null);

getPopupText

public function getPopupText():String

Returns the text that is intended to be displayed in a popup.  This text is selected or generated by the interactivity code that evaluates the activity.

Example

var popupText = pe.getPopupText();
mcPopup.tf.htmlText = popupText;

getButtonText

public function getButtonText():String

This will return the desired text to be shown or associated with the button that closes the popup.  We often choose between ‘close’ and ‘continue’ depending upon the circumstances.  Since this is more the responsibility of the surrounding application, it might make sense to ignore this in certain cases.

Example

var buttonText = pe.getButtonText();
mcPopup.mcButton.tf.htmlText = buttonText;

setPopupText

public function setPopupText(t)

setButtonText
